meanings.definition: Capable of being modified or changed.
meanings.sent1: The toy car's modifiability allowed children to customize it with different stickers.
meanings.sent2: The software's modifiability made it easy for developers to update and improve its features.
meanings.sent3: The modifiability of the recipe allowed for creative variations in the final dish.
meanings.sent4: Her modifiability in fashion choices reflected her ever-evolving personal style.
meanings.sent5: The modifiability of the building design ensured it could adapt to future needs.

meanings.definition: The quality of being able to be altered or adjusted.
meanings.sent1: The modifiability of the schedule made it convenient for last-minute changes.
meanings.sent2: Software engineers value the modifiability of code for easier maintenance.
meanings.sent3: The modifiability of the costume allowed for quick adjustments before the performance.
meanings.sent4: The modifiability of the contract terms ensured flexibility for both parties.
meanings.sent5: The modifiability of the furniture layout made it easy to rearrange the room.
